availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles "Charlie" E. Dunning (Caldwell co. kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Son of Lemuel Dunning and Sarah J. Dunning. Married to Kate Dunning. Father of Louella Dunning. Resident in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 359A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Pollards Tan Yard, p. 149.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Tennessee, p. 530B.
"Charles Dunning (1835-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #105758518, accessed July 14, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105758518.
